puzzles.description: You encounter a river blocking your path. The only way across is a fallen tree, guarded by your most feared enemy; a mink. Only if you answer the mink's riddle will you be allowed to cross: 'What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?'
puzzles.hint: Look for something that flows and has a mouth.

puzzles.description: A wise owl offers you a riddle: 'I am a solitary word, 5 letters long. Behead me once, I am the same. Behead me again, I am still the same. What word am I?'
puzzles.hint: Think about sounds and how they travel.

puzzles.description: You find a hidden stash of acorns, but it's guarded by Acornelius! To access them, you must answer her question: 'What has keys but can't open locks?'
puzzles.hint: Consider objects that have keys that are not used for locks.

puzzles.description: What has roots as nobody sees, is taller than trees, up, up it goes, and yet it never grows?
puzzles.hint: Think of something tall and immovable.
